content.body: "utf-eight"
Hixie: I have finished that blog topic I had mentioned writing.  What do I do now?  Post it here?
cbright6062: ping annevk, he's more up on the blog than i am
cbright6062: I can give you an account
cbright6062: could you email your post to annevkâŠ™oc ?
cbright6062: if there's nothing weird I'll set you up
annevk: how was the Notification meeting?
went well I think
posted a summary on the list
k
annevk: btw, have you looked at the Web Performance specs lately? plh tells me they are transitioning a bunch of them
I remember you had commented on some of them before
might be worth going back and checking to see whether they actually responded to your comments
somdbody's doing spring cleaning!
MikeSmith: is any F2F action happening yet?
nope
not for another 12 hours or so
ah good
annevk: you want a ride tomorrow?
MikeSmith: I guess I should, but that group kind of gives the same vibe as geolocation
yeah
MikeSmith: it looks walkable... I kind of want to try walking
ok
my an plh going there pretty early anyway
8am
ow
might have to do the same in case the walking fails :p
in other news, just finished Half-Life 2
cool game
does Valve make any web-based games/
haven't seen any
can't believe I never picked up on this before, still have Episode 1 & 2, and Portal 2
and maybe then they'll release whatever /r/gaming/ gets worked up about every other day
(btw turns out i actually won't be around tomorrow, should be back wednesday)
Enjoy May Day!
is in Sunnyvale
wonders where annevk / mikesmith are staying
hello timeless!
hi othermaciej
discovers which channel/network this is and decides it's time to sleep
has to wake up today and catch a cab or something
see people in <8 hours
later

So in the Google Groups discussion I was just reading, 1) back/forward work in some crazy way I don't understand (they didn't act as inverses), 2) the place I'm scrolled to in the page isn't preserved on back/forward, 3) when I got to the end of the page it refused to let me scroll down and I have no idea why because there's no visible scrollbar.
Yay for HTML5!
Finally allowing us to create hard-to-use pages that ignore all established UI conventions but are fully standards-compliant!
I guess it would have been even worse without all the new APIs . . .
At least back and forward *sort of* work.
timeless: "quality" inn
there might actually be an observable difference too between just tokenizing and using an insertion mode
consider e.g. "test<tr>" as input
More extreme given foreign content and breaking out of it.
example?
annevk: No, too close to exam time :P
Loading a page from cache, if it wasa originally sent with Set-Cookie, will that cookie be set again on cache load?
gsnedders: exams
good morning, Whatwg!
where's Ms2ger?
timeless, staying at best western, 2300 el camino
AryehGregor: yt?
annevk: You around?
yeah
annevk: Watch for an email from me.
is https://twitter.com/#!/tabatkins/status/197373135153147906 an IETF troll
annevk: Sent.
thanks
MikeSmith: Well, that too.
cbright6062: okay looks fine
let me get you an account
annevk: Thanks.
password will be emailed to you
okay
let me know if something does not work out
dinosaurs rock
!summon ms2ger
dglazkov: you should look at your normative requirements in the Shadow DOM spec
dglazkov: e.g. the bit about the constructor has no normative requirements
dglazkov: while I guess you want implementations to do something with the constructor
annevk: can you file a bug? I don't want to forget this.
dglazkov: done
annevk++
and posted.
cbright6062: can you adjust the heading levels maybe?
cbright6062: blog post itself is h2, anything inside ought to be h3 or lower
okay
fixed.
annevk: I was just following the standard I've learned for heading levels.  Fixed though, since you seem to use a different scheme.
cbright6062: are you still getting and DB errors from wiki.whatwg.org?
MikeSmith: No
ok
rafaelw_: btw, http://krijnhoetmer.nl/irc-logs/whatwg/20120501#l-448
rniwa, in general I'm not around during American working hours -- I'm now in Israel, GMT+0200.
AryehGregor: ah, ok
Right now I just logged on for a few minutes.
AryehGregor: when can i talk to you?
E-mail or bug report posting or whatever is best.
AryehGregor: okay.
AryehGregor: will do that.
When I'm working it's generally between 8:30 and 6:00 my time, which is 10:30 PM to 8:00 AM Pacific time.
And usually now more like 8:30 to 2:00, so even the East Coast I can't talk to much.
annevk: does dom4 spec try to load something from whatwg?
the latter seems to be very slow atm
odd
several people have reported several weird failure modes on that server today
and i can't reproduce any of them
smaug____: yes
smaug____: stylesheet and script
smaug____: maybe just a script these days
that is silly  ;)
smaug____: it's at the end of the document
given that whatwg.org isn't very reliable server
and helps with cross-references
w3.org isn't either
true
but the doc is in w3.org
if you volunteer maintaining that file you could host and maintain it on w3.org and I'll link it, no problem
By the way, just making a random observation: I find it amusing that the blog hasn't been formatted with the newer HTML coding.
never taken the time to update the markup
ah, makes sense.
well we have one or two times, back then support for new elements was spotty
ah
the new markup is a lot more universally supported now.
it's actually why I had originially formatted my article the way I did.
Lol
yeah, I guess if there's a good reason to update the markup again that aspect would be updated as well
may have somewhat broken html5lib tip by making it assert where we previously did bogus stuff
annevk: well, if you ever need a hand with it, I'd be willing to help.  (updating code is actually one of my favorite things to do.)
http://code.google.com/p/html5lib/issues/detail?id=202
if you're interested in doing that, sounds fine to me
I'd have to figure out how to give you ssh access I guess
annevk: I'm fully interested and fully willing to help.
jgraham: see above html5lib bug
cbright6062: so I can give you access via the WordPress interface right away
jgraham: (202)
cbright6062: ssh access is something Lachy can maybe arrange
annevk: sounds fine to me.  Just send me through the proper channels.  As for the Wordpress side of things, I'm ready as soon as you are.
seems whatwg.org is a little slow, but you'll be an Admin soonish which will allow you to update the pages
not quite an ideal interface to edit markup, but it works
annevk: I actually do it that way on a daily basis. Lol
well hey, if it works for you :)
cbright6062: you should be set now, have fun and don't kill it :)
annevk: I noticed.  And trust me, I won't kill it.
anyone happen to remember a post with ian's argument against using URLs as identifiers for things that aren't actually resources (eg. XML namespaces)?
would like to be lazy and point to it rather than make it from scratch, heh
found one (webintents)
You know what would make removing dependencies on implicit unicode/str conversion easier in html5lib? Not have the stdlib rely upon them.
each year this push stuff
meh
dglazkov: what is the language in "Matching Insertion Points" trying to accomplish?
dglazkov: subsetting Selectors in that way seems like a bad idea
(Shadow DOM spec)
dglazkov: "host element" -> "shadow host"
